website_summaries.verdict: The Adidas Pure Boost ZG brings comfort, flexibility and durable support to the runner. Each step becomes natural because of its soft coverage, the responsive mid-sole system, and the layered EVA outsole. Neutral runners are going to have a great time with this Adidas running shoe.
pros: The upper unit of the Pure Boost ZG features a fabric that naturally expands with the foot, giving a comfortable fit
The inner sleeve is smooth, so it doesn’t cause irritation to the skin
A good number of runners noted that the slightly expensive price was reasonable and worth it because of the great quality of this shoe
The many different color options for this shoe heightens its visual appeal
The boost™ mid-sole keeps the foot well-cushioned at all times
The outsole unit uses a thick EVA layer for a smooth and easy ride
The moderate weight doesn’t make the runner feel as if they’re weighed down by this shoe
cons: A few felt that the elastic strap that goes around the mid-foot section got in the way of the shoelaces

customer_reviews.title: Super-Comfortable Shoes; Order 1/2 Size Up; Check Treads For Rocks
customer_reviews.text: So I say that these fit somewhat small, as from other reviews, I ordered up a half size. I'm usually a 9, I ordered a 9.5 and they fit perfectly. These shoes are so freakin' comfortable, I almost never want to take them off! The only downside to them is the sole tread; they have an open tread with about 1/4" 'holes' in them. When you're walking on gravel or acorns, things wind up getting caught in them, so if you have hardwood floors or walk on other surfaces that may scratch easily, be sure to check the bottoms and remove any debris you might have picked up.
customer_reviews.author: Austen

customer_reviews.title: Tough to get on and narrow...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the more narrow Adidas you will come across. Adidas is narrow anyway, I have to go up a full size always but man these are narrow. They look great, but sitting at rest it's painful. I recommend the Cloud Foam and Crazy series for a wider shoe.
customer_reviews.author: 80's Kid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe, but fits small due to attached tongue
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are incredibly comfortable and look slick. This one comes with a sole unlike another pair of Pureboosts I recently acquired. Just be aware that you may have to go 1 or 1.5 sizes up, I typically wear 11 and found 12.5 to be most comfortable. The entry of the shoe features an attached tongue flap, so if you have wider feet like me, you will have trouble getting your foot in the top and require a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Zhanger

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing just about twice a week for several months now and the condition is still near flawless. Adidas really hit a home run with the material used in these shoes. I am a big fan of the straps as well as the unique laces. I think these characteristics really set them apart from the ever so crowded shoe market. The boost technology allows for what it feels like an extra "umph" in every stride. I would recommend these trainers for daily wear as well as casual gym shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Hungate

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable walking/running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable walking/running shoes. Compared to the Ultra Boost, slightly lighter in weight (11 oz. vs 12 oz.). Comfort and impact protection is a bit less due to less volume of the boost material. However durabiliy is much better due to a much thicker outsole. Size run very small. I normally wear 11-11.5 and the 11.5 fits very snug although the knit stretches. Recommend going half a size up. For half the price of an ultra boost, shoe is a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S Enriquez Jr

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: The moment I open the box, I feel in love. I'd always wanted to buy myself the Ultra Boost. But sadly my parents think they're too expensive. These are the lesser version of ultra boost, and are extremely comfortable. Over the best shoes I've worn and laid my eyes on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are a great alternative to Adidas UltraBoost or NMD's
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to Adidas UltraBoost or NMD's. They are more comfortable than NMD's and a step down from the Ultraboost's. They also run small so make sure to get a half size up. Aside from that, they look amazing and a more affordable alternative to Adidas other models.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Sevilla

customer_reviews.title: snug but great color
customer_reviews.text: I liked these shoes a lot but sadly they run a bit short and the next size up wasn't available so I had to return them for a refund. Seem like they would be super comfortable if my toe wasn't smashed into the front.
customer_reviews.author: FLbookworm22

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! This is my 4th pair actually. Been reliable so far. I've been wearing this during my runs every morning, grip and support is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul

customer_reviews.title: These do not fit true to size
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 pairs of these in dark green, royal blue and black and grey. All 3 fit perfectly in a size 12. However, these in red don't fit like the others. These were super tight. I'm going to try a 1/2 size up and see what happens. Besides the size, I love these shoes. They are super comfortable. I could run in these all day long.
customer_reviews.author: ebola3

customer_reviews.title: Super Grip
customer_reviews.text: Grip on floor can be compared to a gold-digger holding on to a 90-year old millionaire. I tripped thrice now, just by walking. Light. Comfortable. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: hopemd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes, can wear casually or in a light ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit is tight. I wear 11 in all adidas shoes, should have bought 11.5 in these. Comfortable shoes, can wear casually or in a light workout. Sprinting in these shoes may be awkward because they feel like they'd slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vani

customer_reviews.title: so comfortable, good for running
customer_reviews.text: i had the first pureboost two years ago, color black also, so comfortable,good for running, hiking and casual use. i bought them at adidas shop in westfields mall new jersey. those pair are almost worn out due to almost everyday use. fits perfect.. size 11 u.s.... so decided to order another one, designed is very nice, first time to use them for running, disappointed with the fit, too tight, small for its size.

customer_reviews.text: I have a couple pairs of this exact shoe in different colors. The others were purchased directly from Adidas. These fit totally different than my others. I would not recommend buying from this seller.

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous Maroon
customer_reviews.text: Bought a half size up after reading the reviews. I normally wear a 7.5 and the size 8 fits nicely. Very comfortable shoe with plenty of cushioning. The maroon colour is absolutely marvelous.

customer_reviews.text: It was perfect choice to buy this and above all, cushioning and feels to hit ground are wonderful and enjoy running, but one thing, as i mentioned earlier, feels too low/narrow at front part of shoe,just touching toes during running,i mean long distance running like over 6 to 10 miles away.

They still fit for the most part, but my toes are almost scrunched up, I would have gotten a half size bigger had I known they would fit smaller than the gray ones I already have.

customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes that I have ever owned! They are like wearing slippers. Make sure you order at least a half size up. I normally wear a size 10 and got ordered these in a 10.5 and they fit perfectly.

customer_reviews.text: They fit as expected and feel great so far. The cushion on the heel of the shoe may be a little more than I'd like, but I'm pleased for only having had the a week.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, can be difficult to keep clean

I really like the boost material when running as it makes for very low impact. The only thing I don't like is the ultra bright white side walls. It seems like everything gets them dirty. I'm constantly cleaning these unlike some of my other shoes. If the side walls came in anything but white I would give these 5 starts.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing comfort and fit coupled with a great look
customer_reviews.text: I have been a huge fan of the nike free runs and flynits but Adidas has done an amazing job with their pure boost line. They look great and feel amazing. The shoes fit perfectly based on my US shoe size. If you are looking for a supported soft feel when you walk these shoes are it. The knit material helps with keeping your feet dry when you are training as well. Great design and great feel.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING QUALITY AND COMFORTABILITY!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a committed customer of Nikes because of their comfortable Free Run shoes. I decided to purchase this Adidas Pure Boost to give it a try and I am speechless. This pair of shoes is very, very comfortable and light. I am definite I will be able to walk many hours with these comfy shoes. It may be a bit pricey but I think it is well worth it. However, since this is my first Adidas Pure Boost, I don't know what will happen to the soles.

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks great . But it runs very small , better go up at least half a size , probably a full size . The real problem is it's very narrow width. If you have a wide foot , forget it . It's very snug on a regular foot but if you can get it on , it's very comfortable and easy to like. Too bad it's not offered in a wide width , it would be perfect .

I had a problem with Adidas Response Boost in terms of narrowness how most people are reviewing that these particular shoes have that problem, however, I did not encounter it in this case. I would have ordered a half or a full size up because of how much I like the shoe but there are none in stock. I was simply forced to return these.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for those that need the cushioning support for their ...
customer_reviews.text: My Husband loves these shoes. He has had three back surgeries and hasn't been able to find a shoe that gives them the support and comfort that he needs. Highly recommend for those that need the cushioning support for their backs.

customer_reviews.title: I tried this shoe on in a store, so ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried this shoe on in a store, so I was surprised that the shoes I received - although being the same size (10) as the ones I tried on - were just a bit shorter. Unfortunately I wore them outdoors with the hopes that I would get used to the slightly different size, so I can't really return them. As it is, I can't wear them for very long without my toes starting to hurt - and I'm usually a size 9.5!

customer_reviews.title: Quality/durability of outsole is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I hardly used these for 3 weeks on the treadmill (accumulated 20 mi at most) and the tread is almost flat..guess the boost foam will have to serve as the sole in 2 months. Just not what is expected from a $120 shoe. Wish I could return these.

customer_reviews.text: Ordered the orange and white. The shoe showed up all orange. Returned for the grey; luckily they had it in a 15. Hopefully it'll show up and be the right item.

customer_reviews.title: Never again....Sport Hub Central!
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was not same color as shown on website! I did try on and wear for 1 run on treadmill, but wasn't crazy about it. Figured with that and color issue, I would return. Sent back to Sport Hub Central. Received email 3 days later saying they thanked me for pointing out discrepancy with color (and they agreed it was wrong) but they could not refund money due to shoes having been worn (once!). So they returned to me. Love the Adidas boost material, just did not like the color (bright blue vs the very light blue the pic showed). Will NEVER buy from Sport Hub Central again!

product_meta.title: Adidas Men's Pureboost ZG Running Shoe
product_meta.description: If you're a runner or just general athlete, you know how critical it is to find a pair of men's athletic shoes able to provide you with the comfort and support you need to stay one step ahead of the rest. A good set of footwear can make it or break it when it comes to enduring the rigorous workouts you wear them for. Fortunately, Adidas shoes were created with your lifestyle in mind. Adidas shoes feature a well-crafted rubber sole deliberately designed to withstand the strain and impact of prolonged activity. The sole exhibits a cushioning support system providing you with the level of stability and durability you need to keep up the pace. Additionally, a synthetic fabric lends a degree of relief and comfort as you move throughout the day. The synthetic fabric excels at absorbing moisture while giving your feet the room they need to breathe. The overall design of Adidas shoes focuses on style and stamina, making them the best athletic shoes for those seeking competitive footwear that doesn't compromise on style. If you're looking for a great pair of athletic or running shoes to help you increase your performance, Adidas shoes can help push you to your peak.
feature_bullets: Lace-up running shoe featuring breathable air mesh upper and dynamic fit system
